channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Top Instagram reels from Goats and Soda in 2025: Plumpy'Nut, aid cuts, soccer grannies
item.description: Our most-viewed Instagram videos include reports from a Rhode Island factory that makes special food for malnourished children and from a tournament for soccer-playing "grannies."
item.content:encoded:
Our most-viewed Instagram videos include reports from a Rhode Island factory that makes special food for malnourished children and from a tournament for soccer-playing "grannies."

(Image credit: From left: Ryan Brown for NPR; Diaa Hadid/NPR; Gabrielle Emanuel/NPR; Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: 'The Rest of Our Lives' takes readers on a midlife crisis road trip
item.description: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.content:encoded: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.dc:creator: Heller McAlpin

item.title: Hunker down with these 13 mysteries and thrillers from 2025
item.description: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.content:encoded: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: Should the U.S. model its vaccine policy on Denmark's? Experts say we're nothing alike
item.description: The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country in northern Europe.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country in northern Europe.

(Image credit: Scott Barbour/Getty Images Europe)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: As insurance prices rise, women puzzle through coverage options for their families
item.description: Figuring out the insurance options for families often falls to women. Some say they're delaying marriage, taking side jobs, and putting their kids on Medicaid as premium prices shoot up in 2026.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

Figuring out the insurance options for families often falls to women. Some say they're delaying marriage, taking side jobs, and putting their kids on Medicaid as premium prices shoot up in 2026.

(Image credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Lynn Arditi

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.content:encoded: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Want a stronger body this year? Our newsletter can help you reach your goal
item.description: If your New Year's resolution is to start resistance training, Life Kit is here to help. Sign up for our Guide to Building Strength and get a month of expert tips on how to create a lasting routine.
item.content:encoded: If your New Year's resolution is to start resistance training, Life Kit is here to help. Sign up for our Guide to Building Strength and get a month of expert tips on how to create a lasting routine.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Amanda Seyfried's tally for 2025: 3 starring roles, 2 Golden Globe nominations
item.description: Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.

(Image credit: Searchlight Pictures/Searchlight Pictures)
item.dc:creator: Phil Harrell

item.title: Christmas is over. Here's what to do with your holiday trash
item.description: Household waste increases by 25% between Thanksgiving and New Years. Rules vary by municipality on what you can recycle and what needs to go into the trash.
item.content:encoded:
Household waste increases by 25% between Thanksgiving and New Years. Rules vary by municipality on what you can recycle and what needs to go into the trash.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ava Pukatch
